item.title: How to Level Up and Increase Rep in Skate 4
item.description:
In Skate 4 , leveling up isn’t just about getting better at tricks, it’s about building up your reputation (Rep) across the neighborhoods of San Vansterdam. Each zone in San Vansterdam has its own Rep meter , and your activities directly affect it.

Ranking up unlocks everything from expanded shop inventories to new fast travel points. That means if you want to experience everything the city has to offer, you’ll need to put in the efforts to increase your Rep in Skate 4 .

How to Level Up and Get More Rep in Skate

As mentioned above, progress in Skate 4 is tied to neighborhoods, not just your character. That means the more you play in a zone, the more Rep you earn, and the better the rewards you get. Here are some of the best ways to increase your Rep and level up fast.

Play Story Missions First

Story missions are a strong way to gain Rep quickly. These campaign-style objectives reward more points than anything else, so if you’re focused on leveling up, complete them whenever possible. They also introduce you to new systems and characters, which makes later challenges easier.

Switch Between Side Missions and Challenges

Once story missions are completed or locked, turn your attention to side missions and timed challenges. Daily tasks refresh every day and are great for steady progress: they’re quick, focused, and stack up over time. Permanent challenges also give you a decent Rep boost. You can use fast travel points in each neighborhood to quickly hop between challenges.

Team Up with Friends

Playing co-op can make leveling up so much easier. When you skate with friends or a party, completing challenges benefits the entire group. In many cases, only one player needs to land the trick or objective for everyone to receive rewards. This makes it much easier to farm Rep, especially if your squad includes skilled players who can help clear difficult objectives.

Skate for Passive Rep

You don’t have to be grinding missions every minute. Tricks, combos, and simply skating around the neighborhood all contribute to its Rep.

Spend your Rip Chips wisely. Focus on the neighborhoods that you’re currently leveling up so the gear and cosmetic rewards directly support your progress there. That way, every Rip Chip spent enhances both your style and your Rep growth in the places you skate most.

6.7 /10

skate.

item.title: All Playable Characters in Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles (Main Party List)
item.description:
Ramza Beoulve is the main protagonist of Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles , although players will be given the option to recruit fifteen additional party members throughout the course of their Ivalicean adventures. Ten of the playable characters are encountered as part of the main story, with the final five tied to some of the game's side stories.

Unlike in a lot of other Final Fantasy games, Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles allows players to choose whether or not they recruit these characters, and they can release them at any time if they so wish. They'll also be able to recruit generic characters from Warriors' Guilds to pad out their party, and will fight alongside guest characters at various points throughout the main story.

All Playable Characters in Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles (Party List)

Byblos

All Guest Characters in Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles

  • Goffard
  • Delita
  • Argath
  • Ovelia
  • Orran
  • Alma
  • Zalbaag

Many of the playable characters in Final Fantasy Tactics appear as guest characters before players are given the chance to recruit them. However, the ones listed above never fully join the party and cannot be controlled by the player at any point during the game.

item.title: How to Unlock Every Job in Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles (All Jobs List)
item.description:
There are 32 jobs in Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles , although players will only have access to two of these to begin with. To unlock more powerful jobs, players will need to increase the level of their existing ones, which they can do simply by using them in battle.

Final Fantasy Tactics - The Ivalice Chronicles has two types of jobs: regular and special. With the exception of Squire, regular jobs can be used by every playable character, but special jobs are unique to certain characters and will replace Squire on the job tree.
